summary: Completed comprehensive testing of expense tracker application focusing on chart rendering and modal interactions. Backend APIs are 100% functional. Frontend core functionality works well, but the main issue persists: data visualization charts are not rendering despite chart containers being present and data being available.

ui_bugs.issue: Charts not rendering despite fixes - ResponsiveContainer elements present (2 found) but no actual chart components (pie, bar, line) are rendering
Modal overlay occasionally blocks clicks during category selection - DialogOverlay intercepts pointer events

integration_issues.issue: Chart containers and ResponsiveContainer elements are present, but Recharts components (PieChart, BarChart, LineChart) are not rendering despite having valid data

passed_tests: User registration with email, password, and name
JWT token authentication and protected routes
Create new expense sheet with name and month
View all expense sheets on dashboard
Add expenses to sheet with date, category, description, amount
Sidebar navigation between Overview and Compare
All 15 backend API endpoints working correctly
Chart containers are properly created when expenses exist
Expense data is correctly displayed in stats cards and table
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix data visualization charts not rendering. The issue is NOT with chart containers or data availability - both are working correctly. The problem is that Recharts components (PieChart, BarChart, LineChart) are not rendering inside the ResponsiveContainer elements. Also fix modal overlay issue that blocks category selection clicks in expense forms.
success_percentage: Backend: 100%, Frontend Core: 90%, Charts: 0%, Modal Interactions: 70%
